title: Inside the Amazon Journey That Left a Journalist and an Activist Dead
abstract: Dom Phillips and Bruno Pereira set off deep into the Amazon to meet Indigenous groups patrolling the forest. Then they vanished.

abstract: Yulia Paievska was already well known in Ukraine when she was captured, but the trauma she describes has made her a symbol of bravery and sacrifice.

title: Where Mantras Trump Medicine, Vaccines Are a ‘Violation’
abstract: The Baduy, an Indigenous group in Indonesia, believe that vaccinations are impure, and unnecessary, and that their beliefs protect them. To skeptics, they note their Covid death toll: zero.
byline: By Muktita Suhartono and Ulet Ifansasti

multimedia.caption: Carrying durian fruit past rice barns on the way to the nearest market. All Baduy are taught to abide by the principle that the natural world is not to be harmed.

title: ‘There’s Nothing’: Scarcity Deepens Desperation in Sri Lanka
abstract: The island nation was once an economic hope, with a growing middle class. Now many people are living on the edge, unable to buy even the basics.

title: Security Forces in China Attack Protesters Seeking Frozen Funds
abstract: After a rare mass demonstration, bank depositors demanding their money back were beaten, kicked to the ground and dragged away in the city of Zhengzhou.
byline: By Zixu Wang and Austin Ramzy

title: Rivals Vying to Replace Johnson Are Diverse in Background, Not in Plans
abstract: The Conservatives running to be Britain’s prime minister include women and people of non-European descent, but they sound a lot alike: They like Brexit and want to cut taxes.

title: Suspect in Abe Shooting Held a ‘Grudge.’ Scrutiny Falls on a Church.

title: A Year After Mass Protest, Cubans Face Stark Choice: ‘Prison or Exile’
abstract: Thousands of Cubans took to the streets last July protesting economic misery. A year later, hundreds are in jail and the financial crisis has only worsened.

title: Three cities in China impose partial lockdowns as new cases are reported.
abstract: The cities of Xi’an, Lanzhou and Haikou set restrictions on several million residents. In Macau, the gambling hub, authorities shut casinos and ordered everyone to stay home.

title: Biden Will Find a Changed Middle East on His Coming Visit
abstract: On his first trip to the region since taking office, President Biden will begin in Israel, which has been building relations with Arab nations. He will also make a stop in Saudi Arabia.
